page.title: 01STOCK GREEN AND AREA
page.content: The area is mainly flat and low lying agricultural land. The farm land is mainly used for cattle and sheep grazing, horse breeding and cereal crops. There are two villages, Bradley Green in the north and Stock Green in the centre of the area with the Bow Brook running east to west between them. The southern section of the area has several woods, the largest being roundhill wood. several minor roads cross the area. The majority of the villagers commute to the large centres of Redditch and Birmingham, the others being mainly employed in the agricultural industry. The area is immediately south of a roman road which was a "salt route".
